{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox person | image = Jason_Segel_Sundance_2017.jpg | caption = Segel in 2017 | birthname = Jason Jordan Segel | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1980|1|18}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | occupation = Actor, comedian, screenwriter, producer | years_active = 1998–present | spouse = }} '''Jason Jordan Segel''' ({{IPAc-en|'|s|iː|g|əl}}; born January 18, 1980) is an American actor, comedian, screenwriter, and producer. He is known for his role as [[Marshall Eriksen]] in the [[CBS]] [[sitcom]] ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]'', as well as for his work with producer [[Judd Apatow]] on the television series ''[[Freaks and Geeks]]'' and ''[[Undeclared]]'', and for the critically and commercially successful comedies he has starred in, written, and produced. Segel has starred in several films, including ''[[Knocked Up]]'' (2007), ''[[Forgetting Sarah Marshall]]'' (2008), ''[[I Love You, Man]]'' (2009), ''[[Despicable Me]]'' (2010), ''[[Bad Teacher]]'' (2011), ''[[Jeff, Who Lives at Home]]'' (2011), ''[[The Muppets (film)|The Muppets]]'' (2011), ''[[The Five-Year Engagement]]'' (2012), ''[[This Is 40]]'' (2012), ''[[Sex Tape (film)|Sex Tape]]'' (2014) and ''[[The Discovery (film)|The Discovery]]'' (2017). His performance as the late author [[David Foster Wallace]] in the 2015 film ''[[The End of the Tour]]'' was met with critical acclaim, earning him a nomination for the [[Independent Spirit Award for Best Male Lead]]. ==Early life== Segel was born January 18, 1980, in [[Los Angeles]], to Jillian (née Jordan) and Alvin Segel, a lawyer.{{cite I think that's the nature of groups," he said. "And so everyone wants to compartmentalize people. And I think I decided at that point, like OK, its me versus the world, kind of."'' He has an older brother, Adam,{{cite web|url=http://www.wbur.org/npr/113833274|publisher=''[[Fresh Air]]''|title=Jason Segel Explains the Mysteries of Guydom|date=October 16, 2009|accessdate=June 17, 2014|archivedate=June 18, 2014| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140618000120/http://www.wbur.org/npr/113833274|deadurl=no}} and a younger sister, Alison.{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-segel13apr13,0,6976921.story|work=Los Angeles Times|first=Robert|last=Abele|title=This breakup really broke up Jason Segel|date=April 13, 2008}} Following elementary school and middle school, Segel completed his high school studies at [[Harvard-Westlake School]], where his {{convert|6|ft|4|in|m|2|abbr=on}} frame helped him as an active member of the 1996 and 1997 [[California Interscholastic Federation|CIF]] state champion boys' basketball team.[http://www.buddytv.com/info/jason-segel-info.aspx "Jason Segel Biography"]. Buddy TV. Retrieved February 6, 2013. He won a slam dunk contest in high school{{cite web|url=http://www.maxim.com/entertainment/jason-collins-jason-segels-secret-dunking-past|title=Jason Collins on Jason Segel’s Secret Dunking Past|publisher=|accessdate=March 24, 2018}} and he was nicknamed "Dr. Dunk."{{cite web|url=http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2014/06/jason-segel-the-end-of-the-tour|title=Jason Segel’s High-School Nickname Was “Dr. Dunk”|first=Julie|last=Miller|publisher=|accessdate=March 24, 2018}} He was a backup to the team's star center, [[Jason Collins]], who went on to play in the [[National Basketball Association|NBA]].{{cite news |last= Sondheimer|first=Eric|title=Fastbreak to Silver Screen |date=October 30, 1996 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Daily News]]|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/FASTBREAK+TO+SILVER+SCREEN+%3A+SEGEL+FORSAKES+HOOPS+FOR+ACTING.-a084001064|accessdate=April 29, 2013}} ==Career== [[File:Jason Segel at world of color.jpg|thumb|upright|Segel at the ''[[World of Color]]'' premiere in June 2010]] Segel's first major role was as [[Stoner (drug user)|stoner]] "freak" [[Nick Andopolis]] on the critically acclaimed but short-lived 1999 [[NBC]] comedy-drama series ''[[Freaks and Geeks]]''. The series revolved around a group of suburban [[Detroit]] [[high school]] students circa 1980. Segel personally composed a song for his character, Nick, to sing to the lead female character, Lindsay ([[Linda Cardellini]]).{{cite web|title=gbdesigns.com|work="The William S. Paley Television Festival: A Dedication to 'Freaks and Geeks'"|url=http://www.gbdesigns.com/freaksandgeeks/paley.html|accessdate=January 12, 2007}} Segel had recurring roles on ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'' as Neil Jansen and on ''[[Undeclared]]'' as Eric. He played Marshall Eriksen on the [[CBS]] sitcom ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]''; he had previously stated he would move on to other projects in 2013 when his contract expired,{{cite web|url=http://www.timeslive.co.za/entertainment/2012/08/01/jason-segel-to-quit-how-i-met-your-mother|title=Jason Segel to quit 'How I Met Your Mother'|work=timeslive.co.za|date=August 1, 2012|accessdate=April 17, 2013}} but was successfully convinced to finish the series after its ninth season in 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/12/exclusive-how-i-met-your-mother-to-return-for-season-9-cast-deals-closed-today-after-jason-segel-turnaround-show-was-given-up-for-dead-until-11th-hour|title=EXCLUSIVE: 'How I Met Your Mother' To Return For Season 9; Cast Deals Closed Today After Jason Segel Turnaround; Show Was Given Up For Dead Until 11th Hour|work=Deadline.com|first=Nikki|last=Finke|date=December 21, 2012|accessdate=April 17, 2013}} Feature film appearances include ''[[Slackers (film)|Slackers]]'', ''[[SLC Punk!]]'', ''The Good Humor Man'', and ''[[Dead Man on Campus]]''. In 2007, he appeared in ''[[Knocked Up]]'', directed by ''Freaks and Geeks'' producer [[Judd Apatow]]. Segel starred in the lead role of 2008's ''[[Forgetting Sarah Marshall]]'', a film he wrote and Apatow produced with [[Shauna Robertson]] for [[Universal Pictures]]. He also starred in ''[[I Love You, Man]]'', which was released on March 20, 2009 by [[DreamWorks]].Vilkomerson, Sara (March 10, 2009). [http://www.observer.com/2009/movies/romantic-comedy-about-two-straight-men-john-hamburg%E2%80%99s-i-love-you-man-might-be-first-dude A Romantic Comedy About Two Straight Men: John Hamburg's I Love You, Man May be the First Dude Flick With a Heart] (HTML). [[The New York Observer]], LLC. Retrieved on March 11, 2009 In ''Forgetting Sarah Marshall'', Segel's character writes a "[[Dracula]]" musical performed by puppets. He also appeared in a [[Full frontal nudity#Terminology|full frontal nude]] scene in the film.{{cite web |title=Jason Segel Goes Full-Frontal In "Forgetting Sarah Marshall" |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2008/04/17/jason-segel-goes-full-fro_n_97169.html |date=April 25, 2008 |work=[[The Huffington Post]] |accessdate=April 17, 2013}} In an interview,Opie and Anthony, 104.1 WBCN in Boston he stated that the Dracula musical with puppets, as well as being broken up with while naked, were real experiences he wrote into the movie. Those cloth creatures were custom-made by the [[Jim Henson Company]], and the experience emboldened Segel to pitch his concept for a [[Muppets]] movie.{{cite journal |url=https://variety.com/2008/film/news/segel-and-stoller-take-on-muppets-1117982291/ |magazine=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=March 12, 2008 |first=Michael |last=Fleming |title=Segel and Stoller take on Muppets |accessdate=April 17, 2013}} Segel performed a song from the film, "Dracula's Lament", on the 1000th episode of ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]''. [[File:SegelJonesRuddILoveYouManMarch09.jpg|thumb|Segel with [[Rashida Jones]] and [[Paul Rudd]] at the ''[[I Love You, Man]]'' premiere, March 2009]] For the 2010 comedy ''[[Get Him to the Greek]]'', Segel co-wrote most of the soundtrack's music which was performed by the fictional band [[Russell Brand#Music and Infant Sorrow|Infant Sorrow]]. He also appeared on ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'' and sang an original song entitled "Wonky Eyed Girl".{{cite av media|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ol4e-a9T4CM&feature=related|title=Craig Ferguson has Jason Segel serenade his "Wonky Eyed Girl"|work=youtube.com}} In 2010, he voiced Gru's arch-rival Vector in the Universal's CGI animated film, ''[[Despicable Me]]'' and appeared as "Horatio" in a [[Fantasy film|fantasy]] [[comedy film]] ''Gulliver's Travels'' directed by [[Rob Letterman]] and very loosely based on Part One of the 18th-century [[Gulliver's Travels|novel of the same name]] by [[Jonathan Swift]]. Segel appeared in ''[[Bad Teacher]]'', starring [[Cameron Diaz]], which opened in June 2011. He played gym teacher and thwarted suitor Russell Gettis.[[Manohla Dargis|Dargis, Manohla]], [https://movies.nytimes.com/2011/06/24/movies/cameron-diaz-in-bad-teacher-review.html "When the Teacher Gets High Marks in the Raunchy and the Profane"], ''The New York Times'', June 24, 2011. Retrieved June 26, 2011. Along with [[Nicholas Stoller]], Segel approached [[Disney]] in 2007 to write the latest ''[[The Muppets|Muppets]]'' [[The Muppets (film)|film]]. Disney was unsure on how to take the request, as Segel had just done frontal nudity in ''Forgetting Sarah Marshall'', but after realizing that he was an avid fan, the project was approved. Segel stated that he wanted to do the film because the last film in the series to be released in theaters was ''[[Muppets from Space]]'' in 1999, and he felt that the younger generation was missing out on enjoying one of his childhood favorites.{{cite web|author=Jay Leno|url=http://www.nbc.com/the-tonight-show/video/jason-segel-part-2-11-8-11/1367383|title=The Tonight Show with Jay Leno - Jason Segel, Part 2 (11/8/11) - Video|publisher=NBC.com|accessdate=August 10, 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120418040252/http://www.nbc.com/the-tonight-show/video/jason-segel-part-2-11-8-11/1367383|archivedate=April 18, 2012}} Segel decided not to star in the sequel to ''The Muppets'', ''[[Muppets Most Wanted]]''.{{cite web|author=Angela Dawson/Front Row Features|url=http://www.knoxville.com/news/2012/mar/13/knoxville-movies-jason-segel-jeff-who-lives-home|title='Home' boy: Jason Segel 'was just born hilarious'|publisher=Knoxville.com|accessdate=August 10, 2012}} He filmed ''[[The Five-Year Engagement]]'', with [[Emily Blunt]], in spring 2011, in Michigan, and the film was released on April 27, 2012. Segel will also be in the cast of a film based on the [[Federation of Quebec Maple Syrup Producers#Strategic reserve|2012 Quebec maple syrup heist]], which will be directed by Seth Gordon.{{cite news| url= http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/sony-picks-up-maple-syrup-635505|work=The Hollywood Reporter|title=Sony Picks Up Maple Syrup Heist Project, Jason Segel Attached to Star|date=September 24, 2013}} In 2013, Segel revealed he was working on a series of young adult novels, based on a story he conceived when he was 21.{{cite news| url= http://www.3news.co.nz/Jason-Segel-writing-young-adult-book-series/tabid/418/articleID/293414/Default.aspx|work=3 News NZ |title= Jason Segel writing young adult book series| date=April 8, 2013}} In the fall of 2014, the first novel of the series ''[[Nightmares!]]'', co-written with [[Kirsten Miller]], was released, with the followup coming out the following year.[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/jason-segel-sells-three-book-444855 ''Jason Segel Sells Three-Book Children's Series''] hollywoodreport.com, 23 April 2013[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/23/books/review/jason-segel-reads-nightmares.html?_r=0 ''Children's Audiobooks - Jason Segel Reads "Nightmares!"''], New York Times, November 21, 2014. In 2015, Segel received praise{{cite news | last = Tallerico | first = Brian | title = ''The End of the Tour'' | work = [[Rogerebert.com]] | pages = | language = | publisher = | date = January 24, 2015 | url = http://www.rogerebert.com/sundance/sundance-2015-the-end-of-the-tour }}{{cite news | last = Nashawaty | first = Chris | title = ''The End of the Tour'' | work = [[Entertainment Weekly]] | pages = | language = | publisher = | date = July 29, 2015 | url = http://www.ew.com/article/2015/07/29/the-end-of-the-tour-ew-review}}{{cite news | last = Lawson | first = Richard | title = ‘The End of the Tour Is a Deeply Affecting Tribute to a Cherished Writer, and a Huge Breakthrough for Jason Segel | work = [[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]] | pages = | language = | publisher = | date = January 25, 2015 | url = http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2015/01/end-of-the-tour-review }} for his portrayal of the late author [[David Foster Wallace]] in the independent biographical drama film ''[[The End of the Tour]]''. For his performance, he earned an [[Independent Spirit Award]] nomination for [[Independent Spirit Award for Best Male Lead|Best Male Lead]].{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/spirit-awards-nominees-2016-carol-1201647728/|title='Carol', 'Spotlight', 'Beasts of No Nation' Lead Spirit Awards Nominations |last=McNary |first=Dave |work=''[[Independent Spirit Awards]]'' |publisher=''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' |date=November 24, 2015}} In 2017, Segel and Miller released their first young adult novel, ''Otherworld''. ==Personal life== Segel is an ordained minister with the [[Universal Life Church]].{{cite web|url=http://www.aoltv.com/2010/07/07/ordained-minister-jason-segel-marries-couple-on-tonight-show|title=Ordained Minister Jason Segel Marries Couple on 'Tonight Show' (VIDEO)|publisher=Aoltv.com|accessdate=August 10, 2012}} He performed a wedding ceremony on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'' on July 6, 2010, for a couple that solicited his services by placing wanted pictures of him around his home town and the bar he frequently visited.{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/12/12/fashion/weddings/12FIELD.html | work=The New York Times | first=Ari | last=Karpel | title=Kevin Smith, Kathy Griffin and Jason Segel Officiate at Weddings | date=December 10, 2010}} Segel is a [[Chain smoking|chain smoker]], and in a 2008 interview, his ''How I Met Your Mother'' costar [[Alyson Hannigan]] claimed that she found it hard to kiss him because of the smell, claiming that she felt like she was 'kissing an ashtray'. {{cite web|title=Jason Segel is a smoker|url=http://www.digitalspy.com/tv/ustv/news/a130726/hannigan-i-hate-kissing-tv-hubby/}} He attempted to [[Smoking cessation|quit smoking]] during one year of the show but has since relapsed.{{cite web|url=http://whatculture.com/tv/20-mind-blowing-facts-you-never-knew-about-how-i-met-your-mother?page=2|title=20 Mind-Blowing Facts You Never Knew About How I Met Your
